Patch.name: Super Duper Reaction Looper - Version 1.2
Patch.Description:
Rewrites all of reaction routine as a double loop. This checks reactions in this order: presence of ability, rng check, presence of proper flags. If any of those checks fail, it checks the next reaction in the list. Why would I do this, you ask?
1. Writes whatever trigger you want to (almost) any reaction you want. Normally this is hardcoded to the skillslot, in a way that wasn't changeable until now! This means that you can also give triggers to blank abilities in a way that is more efficient than the old "multi-reaction gets damage trigger" and that abilities aren't necessarily only able to get damage triggers.
2. Reactions can now freely stack with each other. In vanilla, they could only stack if they were on different priority lists, because the vanilla code ignores the rest of the abilities in the list it's checking if it gets a hit on the ability. This means, for example, that you can now equip a character with both Counter and Counter Magic and it will now work, reacting to flags as appropriate.
3. Reactions are reordered in this check in a way that's a bit more interesting, but still efficient, pushing critical x abilities early in the list. It checks these slots in order: Face (Faith) UP, HP Restore, MP Restore, Critical Quick, Meatbone Slash, Counter Magic, Counter Tackle, Counter Flood, PA Save, MA Save, Speed Save, Sunken State, Caution, Dragon Spirit, Regenerator, Brave UP, Absorb Used MP, Gilgame Heart, Reflect, Auto Potion, Counter, Distribute, MP Switch, Damage Split, Weapon Guard, Finger Guard, Abandon, Catch, Blade Grasp, Arrow Guard, Hamedo
4. Disables most of Distribute's vanilla code. See my other hack to disable it fully.
5. WAYYYY more efficient! Frees space between 0x0018ccd8 - 0x0018cfe4 and 0x0018d29c - 0x0018d380, battle bin.
6. If you want to expand this to use other types of triggers than vanilla did, it is easier to do so than to try to edit vanilla's code, but you're on your own with that one.
Directions for use: Set the trigger that you want for each ability by the the slot in the trigger table. Use the order of abilities listed above. Set "Reflect" to 00 since it's unusable. If you are using the vanilla effects or my "using the screwed up slots" or "Distribute = Synchronize" hacks for Hamedo, Distribute, Weapon Guard, Finger Guard, Abandon, Catch, Blade Grasp, Arrow Guard; set these to 00 as well. 01 = MP Cost, 02 = Critical, 03 = HP Damage, 80 = Counter Flood, 40 = Counter Magic, 10 = Counter Grasp.
It is highly recommended that you disable Distribute's vanilla effect with this hack, instead of trying to make it work here. Nerfed versions of Damage Split and MP Switch do not work with this hack, unless you rewrite the damage split/MP switch section to do so yourself.
Version 1.2 - Separates MP Switch calculation. This was done because before it wasn't working properly. Set MP Switch's reaction trigger to 00 in the main code. This turns MP switch into a "free" priority ability (as in, it can react to anything and get another reaction). This effect isn't 100% intended but since I don't have a problem with it I'm keeping it.

Patch.name: Weapon damage rewrite
Patch.Description:
Unarmed = PA^2, Dagger = Butterknife (1 damage always), else PA * (PA+wp)/2 or MA * (MA+wp)/2 (if 0x80 is used under wp). Frees 0x80 and 0x40 from wp to be used as flags.
*Fixed typo version*

Patch.name: Multi-Reaction Deluxe
Patch.Description: Changes several reaction abilities. Abilities function as Counter Tackle (uses ability that is indexed by 2nd table, as reaction indexed by 1st table). Change the corresponding scus flag to 29 for each ability you are changing. Credit goes to secondadvent for rewriting this so it works. :)

Patch.name: Sicken 2.0
Patch.Description: All physical attacks by a unit apply Poison (in addition to regular effects). Requires Disable Secret Hunt/train and Monster Skill nullifies M-ev hack. This version written to work with Darkness applied to both Physical and Magical abilities.

Patch.name: Monster Skill = Arcane Focus, Ignore Height = inflicts Don't Move
Patch.Description: Monster skill Nullifies M-ev (works as Concentrate for Magic). Ignore Height inflicts Don't Move on any spells that use the M-ev routine. Works similar to Sicken's code. This version written to work with Darkness applied to both Physical and Magical abilities.

Patch.name: Blade Grasp, Reflect, Arrow Guard, Mold Breaker rewrite
Patch.Description: Makes this code more efficient/change friendly :) Defaults here put Mold Breaker on slot 0x01e5, Blade Grasp on slot 0x01c6, Arrow Guard on 0x01c7.

Patch.name: Equip Crossbow (0x01ca) = Runic
Patch.Description: Works as Blade Grasp for the math skill flag. Requires Blade Grasp/Arrow Guard/Mold Breaker rewrite.

Patch.name: Move XX up rewrite
Patch.Description: This rewrite serves several functions: 1. Changes Move XP/JP up to Move PA/Speed up, respectively. 2. Allows any move XX up ability to stack with any other move XX up ability (in vanilla's code you could only equip one at a time and have it work, since the code is written such that presence of one overrides the checks for the next in the list) 3. Changes Move HP/MP up to both give a bonus of 1/8 max HP/MP, but if unit is ???, will give 1/64 max HP/MP (so giving to bosses isn't a complete death sentence). 4. Improved from my previous code for these abilities because all bonus amounts are displayed! 5. MUCH more efficient - Frees space between 0x0018de54 - 0x0018df08 and 0x00180134 - 0x00180174, battle.bin.

Patch.name: Disables Distribute
Patch.Description:
Completely disables the effects of Distribute. This frees up Distribute's slot for other use (not compatible with Multi-reaction deluxe without further coding), and eliminates any weirdness/bugs that are related to use of Multi-reaction deluxe.
**Works with Super Duper Reaction Looper**

Patch.name: Level Jump 4 (slot 0x018c) = Moody
Patch.Description: Rolls a 1/8 chance at the end of every turn for one of the following effects: +100 hp (healing), +100 mp (healing), +1 PA, +1 MA, +1 Speed, +5 Brave, +5 Faith, Quick. Requires Recategorizing r/s/m, check for presence of ability on unit.

Patch.name: Crit Rate Pack
Patch.Description: Requires check for presence of ability. Contains Serene Grace (0x1e1), RNG Guard (0x19e)

Patch.name: Attack Up = Sheer Force
Patch.Description:
Unit does 1/3 more damage of all types, but loses status procs. Replaces Attack up, and makes M-atk up a blank slot.
New version, requires Proc Rate Pack

Patch.name: Proc Rate Pack
Patch.Description: Requires check for presence of ability. Contains Sheer Force (Attack Up slot), Serene Grace (slot 0x1e1), RNG Guard (slot 0x19e). Alters proc rates for these abilities. Weapons use proc rate as indexed by unknown next to range. If you want them to default to 19%, keep that value 0xff

Patch.name: Checks for presence of ability on unit
Patch.Description: Requires r2 = ability ID that you're checking, r4 = unit data of unit you are checking. Returns r3 = 0 if ability is not present, r3 = 3 if present. Requires disable all equip support abilities, to place it in scus. This routine is placed in scus due to one of my routines in scus requiring it. However if you're only using it for battle.bin stuff, feel free to move it to kanji.

Patch.name: Units get randomized abilities if Random (0x01fe) in Entd
Patch.Description: Version 1.00 - Requires checks for presence of ability on unit, 6 abilities (unusable slot, teleport 2, beast boost, move speed up, warp touch, non-charge) flagged as rare. Frees space from 0x5d154 - 0x5d3c0, scus.

Patch.name: Unknown 1 and 2 = new item attributes
Patch.Description:
Requires No Monster Breeding (overwrites code that lays eggs). Unknown 1 = byte you want affected, Unknown 2 = amount you want it affected by. Adds to item attributes.
Some useful values for byte 1: 33 = PA, 34 = MA, 35 = Speed, 3a = Move, 3b = Jump, 4a-4d = Equippable items (make an item grant the ability to grant other items), 4e-52 = innate statuses, 53-57 = status immunities, etc.
You can even add use of R/s/m through an item this way! :):):)
Credit to Pride to finding my mistake (twice). Version 1.3 improvements: 1. Works! (old version didn't work as more than just a proof of concept, please use this instead) 2. Can affect HP and MP now 3. Works properly with value caps
Does not accept signed values, or values greater than 0x7f for PA/MA/Speed/Move/Jump bonuses. Sorry :(

Patch.name: Monster riding changes!
Patch.Description: "Large" monsters are mountable, "small" monsters can ride. Monster size defined by "stepping stone" check. Teleport bypasses rider validation (so anything with teleport can ride regardless of size). This version works. :)

Patch.name: Move +2 = Range + 2
Patch.Description:
Version 1 Uses 0x00153300 to 0x001533b0 in Kanji Space
Changes Move + 2 into Range + 2. No longer increases Move by 2. Range + 2 increases the range of all abilities that: -Have an Ability ID of less than 0x0170 (no Jump/Item/Throw) -Are not Weapon Range (Attack, Charge, etc.) -Have a minimum range of 2 Will not overflow when used on abilities with 254 or greater range. An ability with 254 range will increase to 255 and a 255 range ability will not increase at all. The AI is also notified of this change and their target finding should increase with this support enabled
**This version requires Disable all move/jump +x to not stack with move+2's vanilla effect**

Patch.name: Faith/Innocent calculation rewrite
Patch.Description: Allows for correct/efficient usage of faith/innocent status in more formulas and abilities. Rewritten for use with Contrary (reverses faith/innocent usage by unit).

Patch.name: Action menu expansion
Patch.Description: Grants access to jump (0x34) if unit has skillset 0x12. Original code by Pride.

Patch.name: Smart PA/MA variation
Patch.Description: Requires disable female/equip x. This will randomly choose whether a monster gets a bonus PA or a bonus MA at creation. Intended for use with pre-raw stat edits (particularly, to remove the regular PA/MA variance on monsters).

Patch.name: Defense and Magic Defense % By Job
Patch.Description: Original code by Pride, fixed by Emmy. Improvements made: 1. Load delay error removed 2. More efficient 3. Framework in place to allow additions to this routine 4. includes attack type = damage flag Requires Tying It All Together 2

Patch.name: Maintenance = bonus damage based on HP lost
Patch.Description: Requires Tying It All Together 2

Patch.name: M-atk up = Healing * 5/4, accuracy * 5/4 on status effects and faith based hit rates
Patch.Description: Requires disabling M-atk up. Requires Tying it all together 3.

Patch.name: Equip Change = increased damage at higher HP/increased hit rate at lower hp
Patch.Description: Requires Tying it all together 2. Requires Tying it all together 3.

Patch.name: Slot 0x1a3 (math skill 5) = No Guard
Patch.Description: Requires Tying it all together 3. Requires check for presence of ability on unit. All abilities that are done to or by a unit with this ability that have a non-0 hit rate will hit 100% of the time. Negates evasion, faith based hit rates, % based hit rates in general. Abilities that have 0% hit rate due to immunity, reflect, or 0 faith on either target/attacker still have 0% hit rate. Ability does not bypass Blade Grasp, Arrow Guard, etc.

Patch.name: Blank Support after No charge (0x01e4) gives unit 50% bonus damage on units that are Hasted or Reraised
Patch.Description: Much more efficient than old version. Requires Tying it All Together 2.

Patch.name: Monster talk = 2x damage if user is critical
Patch.Description: Requires Tying it all together 2. Much more efficient than old version. Multiplies final damage by 2 if user is critical. Uses Monster Talk's slot (0x01d9).

Patch.name: 2 Hands, Attack Up, Martial Arts, 2 Swords rewrite
Patch.Description: A more efficient rewrite of these abilities. This makes it so that you can easily change the amount of bonus given. Defaults are approximations of vanilla's.

Patch.name: Slot 0x1a5 (math skill 3) = Analytic
Patch.Description: Requires check for presence of ability, recategorize r/s/m, tying it all together 2. Attacker with Analytic gets 50% bonus damage on XA*YA based moves if it is slower than the target. Takes into effect haste and slow on both target and attacker, but not any other temporary effects on speed such as my Adrenaline/Frenzy hacks.

Patch.name: Slot 0x1a2 = Damage reduced by a % MP lost
Patch.Description: Requires check for presence of ability. Requires tying it all together 2. Each 2% of mp missing = 1% reduction of damage dealt to this unit.

Patch.name: Slot 0x1a1 = 1/2 damage from non-elemental attacks
Patch.Description: Requires check for presence of ability. Requires tying it all together 2.

Patch.name: Item on body grants damage reduction instead of HP/MP
Patch.Description:
Requires Tying it all together 2. Requires only helmets grant hp/mp. Interprets HP as physical reduction, MP as magical reduction. Damage = damage * xx/128, so armor with a penalty is possible with number greater than 128.
**New version that prevents loading of junk data if something other than armor is in the armor slot**

Patch.name: Tying it all together 2
Patch.Description: Affects XA*YA routine, requirement as listed in description

Patch.name: Tying it all together 3
Patch.Description: Affects accuracy routine. Required for hacks as indicated in descriptions

Patch.name: Ability 0x1c3 = Sturdy
Patch.Description:
Requires Super Duper Reaction Looper set trigger = 0 (if using a reaction slot), and Blade Grasp/AG routine rewrite if using BG's slot. If moved to a support/move slot, requires nothing at all.
Unit has a current hp/max hp chance to survive any attack with 1 hp. For example, a character with 400 current hp and 800 max hp has a 50% chance of an attack that normally does >400 hp damage only doing 399 to it. This will proc separately on multi-hit attacks. For example, an attack hits 3x and does 500 damage each vs. something with 800 hp current/max. First hit, the ability doesn't matter. Second hit, it'll 3/8 chance to proc and leave the unit with 1 hp. Assuming it survives, there's now a 1/800 chance to survive the 3rd hit!

Patch.name: Half of MP => Amplify
Patch.Description: Kanji Space location - 0x00153284 Half of MP now doubles MP costs, but increases the AoE by +1. Currently no AI adjustments and will cause problems with the AI determining skill useablity. Version 0.6 - Fixed display, AI now knows proper MP cost :)

Patch.name: 2 Hands = Extra hits if low on MP
Patch.Description: +1 extra hit if less than 50% mp, +2 hits if 0 MP.

Patch.name: Rewards Hack
Patch.Description: Characters gain +1 level, +300 JP, +5000 gil per battle. This hack is meant to be used with XP/JP gain = 0. This switches to a system of rewards gained per battle and not per action.

Patch.name: Walk on Water = Rivalry
Patch.Description: Walk on Water's slot increases effects of compatibility by 25% for attackers. Has no effect if defender has ability.

Patch.name: Movement Merge
Patch.Description: Turns Float into Terrain Mastery, disables all other slots. Disables Can't Enter Water. A little weirdness with animations such as when 4 deep water is involved.

Patch.name: Equip Spear = +5 speed in critical, Equip Axe = double speed while berserked
Patch.Description: Speed bonus removed when unit is no longer critical.

Patch.name: Equip Gun grants immunity to all evadable attacks, Blank slot after Non charge gives +25% hit rate to hasted or reraised targets, Maintenance gives increased hit rate as unit takes damage (up to 50% bonus).
Patch.Description: Equip Gun Sets hit rate = 0% if attack is evadable. Concentrate/transparent ignores this. Rewritten to work with Mold Breaker

Patch.name: Gain XP Up = Shed Skin
Patch.Description:
Sheds negative status at the end of turn, fa/200% accuracy. More efficient version - requires Faith/Innocent calculation rewrite.
**Version 2.0 - rewritten to work properly with Contrary**

Patch.name: Check for presence of negative status
Patch.Description: Requires r4 = pointer to unit you are checking. Return r2 = 2 if status is present, r2 = 0 if 0 statuses are present. Defines negative status as presence of: blank, petrify, darkness, confusion, bs, silence, cursed, oil, berserk, chicken, frog, poison, slow, stop, charm, sleep, dm, da, ds. Requires Super Duper Reaction Looper (to clear space for this hack, otherwise move it elsewhere). Credit goes to Pride for figuring out why this wasn't working before.

Patch.name: Gain JP Up slot = Marvel Scale, Jump +2 = Guts 2.0
Patch.Description: Requires check for presence of negative status, Super Duper Reaction Looper, Def/Mdef up rewrites. If negative status is present on unit with Marvel Scale, damage dealt to it is halved. If negative status is present on unit with Guts, it deals 1/2 more damage. This version requires disable all move/jump+x to disable jump+2's vanilla effect.

Patch.name: Secret Hunt = +1 PA/MA if unit gets kill, Jump +3 = +1 speed if unit gets kill
Patch.Description: Requires Disable Secret Hunt/Train Slots. Requires Disables vanilla's Move/Jump abilities. **Improved** No longer procs on revival. :)

Patch.name: Arrow Guard blocks Formula 28, 3c, 46
Patch.Description: Arrow Guard blocks Formula 28, 3c, 46 with br% accuracy. Stacks with Arrow Guard's vanilla effect

Patch.name: Class M-ev
Patch.Description: Set magic evade by class! Credit goes to Xifanie for rewriting it to work. :)

Patch.name: Hats give fractional HP/MP bonus or penalty
Patch.Description: HP/MP bonus = max hp or mp * x/128. If my hack that makes hp/mp bonuses only apply to hats is not used, beware that the armor slot will give a fractional bonus of total + hat bonus. Does not touch display.

Patch.name: Physical status multiplier rewrite
Patch.Description: Requires check for presence of ability. Includes code for ability (0x19d) that changes protect's multiplier on a character. Multipliers are in the form of 0xYY/0x80.

Patch.name: Magical status multiplier rewrite
Patch.Description: Requires check for presence of ability. Includes code for ability (0x19d) that changes shell's multiplier on a character. Multipliers are in the form of 0xYY/0x80.

Patch.name: Move +1 = Poison Heal
Patch.Description:
Heals 1/4 max hp if unit is Poisoned, replaces poison's normal effect.
**This version requires disable move/jump+x to not stack with move+1's vanilla effect**

Patch.name: Wall becomes Mist or MP Regen, Blank status becomes MP Poison
Patch.Description: The MP Regen recovers 1/4 of Max MP after each turn. MP Poison depletes 1/4 max mp after each turn.

Patch.name: Slot 0x19b = Wallchange
Patch.Description:
Requires check for presence of ability. Requires all code related to putting Geomancy on one skill (Vanilla elemental routine edit, Elemental tables 2.0, Counter Flood edit). This bundles together my old Oil/Undead routine (original code by FFMaster, my mistakes fixed by Glain).
A unit with ability slot 0x19b takes double damage from the element that corresponds to where he is standing, and does 50% more damage with that element. All other elements are nulled. This effect overrides Oil/Undead's elemental changes. This bonus does not happen twice, such as if unit is hitting self with a weakness. A unit with Mold Breaker (0x1e5) will ignore both the elemental weakness and nullification granted by Wallchange.
**Should not load junk data**

Patch.name: Mime functions as normal Job (last line deleted)
Patch.Description: Mime still can't learn abilities, but otherwise, they should be perfectly normal.

Patch.name: Mime only accesses Mimic skillset
Patch.Description: Meant to be used with Xifanie's mime change (delete last line), and Generic Skillset Fix (to make Mimic skillset function as an ordinary auto learn set).

Patch.name: Silent Walk becomes Flee - FIXED for branching/load issue
Patch.Description: Add 4 move when unit is in critical. Originally written by FFMaster FIXED thanks to Raijinili!!

Patch.name: Inherent RSM Limitation Hack
Patch.Description: The code in vanilla that prevents, for example, a knight from using Equip Armor is replaced with this code. This prevents the player from equipping something innate to the class, but allows all other abilities' use. Bugfix by Emmy. :)

Patch.name: Party lv+ 50+ interpreted as party lv - x
Patch.Description: Party level, Party lv - random, and Party lv +50 are interpreted as Party Level. Party Level +51 is interpreted as Party Level -1, Party Level +52 is interpreted as Party Level -2, etc. through party Lv +99 is interpreted as Party level -49. Set levels and party +1-49 are interpreted as normal.

Patch.name: Cone AoE
Patch.Description: Creates Cone AoE. Enable this on any skill by flagging both Linear and Tri Direction AoE flags. Uses Kanji Space. Uses lines 0x1557fc - 0x155b04. 194 Lines. Does not work with Direct/Stop at Obstacle, as neither does Linear/Tri AoE. Make sure you are using the latest version of FFTPatcher. Version 1.09

Patch.name: Arcing AoE/Range
Patch.Description:
Feeds AoE/Range generation through the Arc Range Routine (0x001798b0), creating an AoE/Range that gains size from height/2 Uses Ability Flags 1 Unknown Flags 0x80 and 0x40. Removes and overwrites the coding otherwise attached to the Unknown Ability Flags (0x0017a6dc) known so far. 0x80 - Arcing AoE 0x40 - Arcing Range Version 1.1
Load delay error fixed by Emmy. :)

Patch.name: Smart brave/faith hack 2.0
Patch.Description: Original idea by DW, Fixed by Emmy. :) What it does: - Brave and faith gradually return to original values when changed - Works in increments of 5 - Works! :)

Patch.name: Relabels star displays for monsters with a monster skillset
Patch.Description: On player side: innate abilities in battle, action abilities in formation/unit list screen. On enemy side, will only display if additional r/s/m given to it (randomly generated or otherwise)

Patch.name: Monsters can use attack
Patch.Description: Changes all monsters to be able to use Attack command. Version 0.03 - Monsters don't get a 2nd skillset randomly.

Patch.name: Removes ability previews for move/jump +1/2/3
Patch.Description: Removes all these previews. Useful if replacing with something else. Credit to Pride for finding routine. :)

Patch.name: Status display images - Fixing bugs
Patch.Description: Charging, Jump, Defending, Performing no longer display "cursed" if using status display = cursed.

Patch.name: Status display images - Rasp
Patch.Description: Display "Rasp" text images when targeting / inflicting Blank status. Requires modifications to FRAME.BIN.

Patch.name: Status display images - Cursed
Patch.Description: Display "Cursed" text images when targeting / inflicting Dark/Evil looking status. Requires modifications to FRAME.BIN.

Patch.name: Status display images - Mist
Patch.Description: Display "Mist" text images when targeting / inflicting Wall status. Requires modifications to FRAME.BIN.

Patch.name: Uncap HP/MP in formation
Patch.Description: Requires uncap hp/mp. Displays the last 3 digits of hp/mp if greater than 999 when hovering over individual characters, and 000 if looking at the formation as a whole.

Patch.name: New display information
Patch.Description: Displays immortal flag, special snowflakes, class defense in place of weapon power/evade%. Requires Special Snowflakes/Defense by class. New values: "R" - 004 if immortal, 000 if not "L" - special snowflakes index number r% - % damage reduction physical l% - % damage reduction magical

Patch.name: Display class m-ev
Patch.Description: Requires class M-ev. Displays the value under Class Ev that is normally hardcoded to 00 as the character's M-ev. This hack only displays in battle (not Unit List or formation screen).

Patch.name: World.bin display changes
Patch.Description: Requires cloned tables for world.bin. Requires Special Snowflakes, Def/Mdef by class, M-ev by class.

Patch.name: Cloned tables for world.bin
Patch.Description: Class M-ev, Defense. Copy/paste these tables from their respective hacks.

Patch.name: Instant skills blink red if unusable due to silence/out of mp
Character with Dark/Evil Looking Marches Normally
Locks job wheel/equip screen for standard monsters
Patch.Description: This means if you change the skillsets for any of the monsters from 5E onwards, it works as a regular monster skillset in that job wheel, change ability, item screen no longer is accessible. No more glitchy job wheel! :)

Patch.name: Disables equip at job change
Patch.Description: Option 12 (Equip at Job Change) does nothing. Code is disabled, so game behaves as if permanently off.

Patch.name: Event Instruction Upgrade v1.13 (modified)
Patch.Description:
Upgrades InflictStatus(), Allows editing more variables and Adds many instructions to use in events, such as: BlockLoop(), LUI(), SET(), Random(), LoadAddress(), UnitAddress(), WorldUnitAddress(), SaveAddress(), UpdateUnit(), MinMax() and Routine(). Automatically recalculates the text offset when necessary removing the need to include a Text() offset for savestate eventing.
**Fixed to remove stack pointer offset errors**

Patch.name: Only helmets grant hp/mp
Patch.Description: Blanks out these fields for armor

Patch.name: Remove HP Cap
Patch.Description: All things cap at 65535 instead of 999 regardless of flags/equipment.

Patch.name: Disables all equip support abilities
Patch.Description: Disables the effect of all "Equip X" support abilities.

Patch.name: Compatibility is no longer calculated twice for no reason in spell accuracy, silly hardcoding to Golem's slot removed
Patch.Description: nop nop

Patch.name: WG hardcoding removal
Patch.Description: Removes hard coding on Weapon Guard?

Patch.name: MBS mimics range and animation of other attack
Patch.Description: Keeps its original effect (unevadable counter in amount of max hp), but uses several properties of attack indexed here.

Patch.name: Counter = physical counterpart to Counter Magic
Patch.Description: Counter will counter with the same move used on target, going by Countergrasp flag.

Patch.name: Counter Flood uses Flood Ball
Patch.Description: This allows for Counter Flood to work by using an ability instead of vanilla geomancy. If you changed geomancy with my other codes, this is required to make Counter Flood work.

Patch.name: Darkness applies to both Physical and Magical abilities.
Patch.Description: Also makes accuracy penalty only apply to Darkness, not Confusion

Patch.name: Moves Abandon to support abilities
Patch.Description: Abandon support in Equip Katana slot instead of reactions.

Patch.name: Disable Defend. Merge Equip Change, Maintenance, Move-Find on Move-Find's slot
Disables Catch
Patch.Description: Useful if you are replacing Catch with something else.

Patch.name: 2 Hands innate all
Patch.Description: Equip items in 2 hands for more damage! Fixed display! :)

Patch.name: Critical = 1/4
Patch.Description: Critical status applies at 1/4 hp instead of 1/5

Patch.name: Undead always rerise, Treasure disabled
Patch.Description: First part makes undead always rerise. Second part removes treasure.

Patch.name: Silly hardcoding removal, related to skillset 08
Patch.Description: If you use skillset 08 (charge) for anything other than charge, you want to use this hack. This eliminates the hardcoding that causes characters to cancel their own spells by moving.

Patch.name: Disables Gained XP Up Slot
Patch.Description: Useful if you want to use the slot for something else.

Patch.name: Golem checks for Countergrasp flag
Patch.Description: Golem blocks all attacks with the Countergrasp flag.

Patch.name: Disables Ignore Height, Any Ground, Any weather
Patch.Description: Disables these so that another ability can be written in their slots

Patch.name: Disables all move/jump +x
Patch.Description: Requirement for hacks as listed in descriptions. Frees space between 0x0005c93c - 0x0005c980, scus.

Patch.name: January 1 = Serpentarius
Patch.Description: Serpentarius is no longer hardcoded to a job slot, but to the date January 1. This means that you can set any unit to have Serpentarius via the Entd, and randomized units have a 1/365 chance to appear with Serpentarius. Does not affect Ramza, but can affect any special unit.

Patch.name: Guns are able to proc
Patch.Description: Removes dumb hardcoding.

Patch.name: MP Restore change to cancel/inflict statuses
Patch.Description: Changes MP Restore to Cancel Cursed (if unit is inflicted with cursed), and if unit is not inflicted with Cursed, will inflict on it Float, Transparent, Reraise, Regen, Protect, Shell, Haste, Mist.

Patch.name: Brave up = CT Save (+20 CT, Countergrasp trigger)
Patch.Description: A variation of Pokeytax's boost XX by YY

Patch.name: Faith up = Arcane Quickening
Patch.Description: Casts quick on reaction

Patch.name: Gained JP UP innate all
Patch.Description: Disables the Gained JP Up slot too.

Patch.name: Caution becomes Barrier
Patch.Description: Caution adds protect and shell

Patch.name: Sunken State adds Haste
Patch.Description: Sunken State adds Haste

Patch.name: hpc/mpc/spc/pac/mac of 0 produces 0 growth
Patch.Description: 0 = 0 growth

Patch.name: Learn On Hit = XX%
Patch.Description: Learn On Hit = XX%

Patch.name: Fixed override problem - Allows better stacking of reactions
Patch.Description: Can use additional reactions in entd. Innate reactions in entd no longer override reactions added in entd. Originally made by FDC, I fixed typo.

Patch.name: Recategorizing R/s/m
Patch.Description: Merges Reaction, Support, and Movement. Expands r/s/m slots to 0x18b.

Patch.name: Tying It All Together
Patch.Description: Requirement for hacks as listed in descriptions. Disables Secret Hunt/Train. If you are not using a hack, replace line commented with nop (00000000). If you move a hack, replace commented line to jal (wherever you moved it to).

Patch.name: Slot 0x19a = Attacks done by this unit have a br% chance to also weaken target
Patch.Description: Version 0.02. Requires Tying It All Together

Patch.name: Slot 0x19c = 50% of damage done by unit damages MP
Patch.Description: Requires check for presence of ability on unit. Requires Tying it all together 1

Patch.name: Slot 0x19d = Doubles healing received by target
Patch.Description: Requires check for presence of ability on unit. Requires Tying it all together 1. Works on both HP and MP healing.

Patch.name: Ability 0x19f = Reverses stat changes done to unit, reverses faith/innocent use by unit
Patch.Description:
Requires Check for presence of ability. Requires Tying it all together 1. Requires Faith/Innocent calculation rewrite. Must be placed 2nd to last in tying it all together 1 to stack properly with other abilities.
Version 2.0 - Used correctly by the ai now

Patch.name: Slot 0x1c8 = Immunity to all negative stat changes
Patch.Description: Requires Tying it all together 1. Requires Disable Equip X/Female equips (if you want to keep this ability on the same slot I used and not stack with vanilla's effect, otherwise move its slot). Purpose of this routine is to make stat change formulas stack properly with other abilities. This must go last in Tying it all together 1.

Patch.name: Slot 0x1a0 = Unit heals 1/4 of the damage it deals
Patch.Description: Requires check for ability on unit. Requires tying it all together 1

Patch.name: Slot 0x1a4 = Br% chance to return 1/2 of damage/healing to attacker
Patch.Description:
Requires check for presence of ability on unit. Requires Tying it all together. Works on all types of damage and healing.
Version 0.2 - Now doesn't work on units unable to act

Patch.name: Ability slot 0x18d (Level Jump 5) = fa% chance to raise speed upon using a non-damaging move
Patch.Description: Requires Tying it all together. Requires check for presence of ability. Version 0.02 - does not proc on attacks that miss.

Patch.name: Distribute = Synchronize (Status infliction on a target has a Br% chance to inflict all current statuses on the caster)
Patch.Description:
Disables Secret Hunt/Train (use instead of Disable Secret Hunt/Train hack). Requires Disable Distribute. Requires Tying It All Together.
Version 2.0 - no longer reacts to self casts

Patch.name: Move on Lava = Aftermath
Patch.Description: Upon dealing a killing blow to this unit, it will deal damage equal to its max HP. Bundle with Tying It All Together. :) Bugfix - no longer triggers upon revival of a unit.

Patch.name: Move Underwater = Warp Touch
Patch.Description:
Requires Tying It All Together. Runs off the Counter Flood flag. Attacking an enemy with Warp touch will do a random effect selected from the following: 1. HP Damage equal to target pa^2 (ignores defense) 2. 999 MP damage, inflict Rasp 3. CT 0, inflict slow and stop 4. 25 brave damage 5. 10 faith damage 6. 2 PA, 2 MA damage 7. Inflict Blood Suck, Confusion, Petrify 8. Heals 999 HP/MP
***Version 2.0 - no longer includes Finger Guard (see Tying it all together 1 for new Finger Guard code). HP damage works**

Patch.name: Move +3 = Siphon
Patch.Description: Character doesn't spend MP to cast spells. Instead, he deals MP damage to targets equal to double the normal MP cost of moves in addition to the move's regular effects. Requires Tying it all together. Requires disable all move/jump+x to not stack with move+3's effect.

Patch.name: Defend = Br% +1 PA when unit uses attack with CG flag. Can't enter water = Br% +1 MA when unit uses attack with CM flag.
Patch.Description: Requires Tying It All Together. Requires Disable Defend and Disable Can't Enter Water.

Patch.name: Jump +1 = Rough Skin
Patch.Description: Requires Damage Trigger Passive Pack

Patch.name: Any Weather = Static
Patch.Description: Requires Damage Trigger Passive Pack

Patch.name: Any Ground = Decay
Patch.Description: Requires Damage Trigger Passives Pack

Patch.name: Weapon Guard = PA Save
Patch.Description: Requires Damage Trigger Passives Pack

Patch.name: Finger Guard = MA Save
Patch.Description: Requires Damage Trigger Passives Pack

Patch.name: Level Jump 3 = Speed Save
Patch.Description: Requires Damage Trigger Passives Pack. Requires Recategorizing r/s/m, check for presence of ability on unit.

Patch.name: Catch = Regenerator
Patch.Description: Requires Damage Trigger Passives Pack

Patch.name: Move in Water = Daze
Patch.Description: Requires Damage Trigger Passives Pack.

Patch.name: Abandon = Pressure
Patch.Description: Requires Damage Trigger Passives Pack

Patch.name: Damage Trigger Passives Pack
Patch.Description: Requires Tying It All Together 1. Requirement for hacks as listed in their descriptions
